newsitem.title: FRANCE: Sagem denies Thomson Multimedia bid plan.
newsitem.headline: Sagem denies Thomson Multimedia bid plan.

text.p: French electronics firm Sagem strongly denied on Tuesday a newspaper report it was planning a bid for television maker Thomson Multimedia aimed at blocking its sale to Daewoo Electronics of South Korea.
Thomson Multimedia is a wholly-owned subsidiary of electronics group Thomson SA.

"Following erroneous information published in the daily newspaper Liberation this morning, Sagem denies any interest, and what is more, any negotiations or any contact concerning Thomson Multimedia," Sagem said in a statement.

Liberation earlier reported that Sagem chairman Pierre Faure seemed to be putting together a group of industrial and financial partners to bid for Thomson Multimedia, to prevent its planned sale by Lagardere to Daewoo.
Business daily La Tribune Desfosses reported on Monday an unnamed French businessman was planning a counterbid to Daewoo to keep Thomson Multimedia under French control.
